location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.133 of 1851 from Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commanding Indian Naval Squadron, Persian Gulf, to Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Report from the native agent at Bahrain that Sheikh Alley bein Khalifa [Ali bin Khalifa] and Faysul ben Turkie [Faysal bin Turki] have reached a peace agreement, with the former giving the latter 4000 dollars per year in tribute. Porter states that Faisal has now left El Biddah [al Bidda]. Porter goes on to report that all the subjects of Al Bidda have asked Ali for his pardon, with the exception of Sheikh Futdal [Faddal] of Al-Wakra, who has removed himself to Fars.
